tooltip.title: The Hi-Fi Wizard
tooltip.desc: If you haven't already, he can help you set up bit-perfect on your DAC

welcome.title: Guided DAC Setup
welcome.subtitle: This wizard helps you configure your DAC for bit-perfect playback on Linux.
welcome.intro:
QBZ will not modify your system automatically.
Each step shows the exact commands to run, explains what they do, and lets you decide when to proceed.
welcome.bulletResponsibility: You are responsible for creating, keeping, and restoring your own backups
welcome.bulletNoGuarantee: QBZ follows official documentation and recommended practices, but cannot guarantee results on systems with:
welcome.bulletHelper: This guide is provided as a helper, not a system recovery tool
welcome.systemIssue2: Manually modified PipeWire, Pulse, or WirePlumber setups
welcome.systemIssue3: Commands skipped or executed out of order
welcome.recovery: If anything goes wrong, you can restore your previous configuration using the backup created during this process.
welcome.readyText:
When you're ready, continue step by step.
Nothing will run unless you run it.
welcome.checkbox: I understand and accept these terms

precheck.title: Check Audio Stack
precheck.subtitle: Confirm PipeWire and WirePlumber are running.
precheck.inactiveWarning: If any service is inactive, stop here and fix it before continuing.
precheck.checkbox: I ran this command and services are active
precheck.installSubtitle: Select your distribution to see the install command.
precheck.otherHint: Ensure these packages (or equivalents) are installed: pipewire, pipewire-pulse, wireplumber, alsa-utils

detectDac.title: Identify Default DAC
detectDac.subtitle: We need the exact PipeWire node name.
detectDac.step1: Find your DAC under 'Audio > Sinks'. Note the number (e.g., 46).
detectDac.inputWarning: This must match exactly. One character off will break the rule.

validation.invalidFormat: Invalid format - should start with alsa_output. or alsa_input.
validation.pciDac: Internal audio - bit-perfect depends on hardware

query.disclaimer: If these values don't match your DAC specs, check the manufacturer documentation.

backup.title: Create Backup
backup.subtitle: Required before any changes.
backup.hint: You are responsible for keeping this backup until you verify everything works.

pipewireConfig.title: Allow Multiple Sample Rates
pipewireConfig.subtitle: Enables automatic switching without forcing 48kHz.
pipewireConfig.explanation: By default, PipeWire locks to 48kHz. This config allows your DAC to switch to the track's native sample rate.
pipewireConfig.selectRates: Select sample rates your DAC supports:
pipewireConfig.noRatesHint: No rates selected. Default values will be used.

pulseConfig.title: Choose Apps for Bit-Perfect
pulseConfig.subtitle: Add QBZ and any players you want without resampling.
pulseConfig.warning: Best results: use app-scoped bit-perfect only. Global Pulse bit-perfect can break browsers and apps that output fixed 48kHz.

wireplumberConfig.title: Target Your DAC Only
wireplumberConfig.subtitle: Apply rules only to the detected sink.
wireplumberConfig.rulesNote: These rules apply only to the detected DAC.

restart.title: Restart Audio Services
restart.subtitle: Required to apply changes.
restart.hint: Audio may briefly stop. This is normal.

verify.title: Verify Sample-Rate Switching
verify.subtitle: Play different sample rates and confirm RATE changes.
verify.instructions:
1. Open a terminal and run: pw-top
2. In QBZ, play a 44.1kHz track
3. Check that RATE shows 44100
4. Play a 96kHz track
5. Check that RATE shows 96000
verify.success: RATE should change to match each track's sample rate.
verify.rollbackHint: Run these commands to restore your previous configuration:

done.title: Setup Complete
done.subtitle: Your DAC is configured for bit-perfect playback.

error.title: Need Help?
error.body: If something went wrong, check these resources:

welcome.title: Remote Control Setup
welcome.subtitle: Control QBZ from another device
welcome.intro: This guide will help you set up remote control so you can control QBZ from your phone, tablet, or another device on the same network.
welcome.feature4: Install as PWA on your device

enable.title: Enable Remote Control
enable.subtitle: Turn on the local API server
enable.portNote: The default port is 8182. You can change it if needed, but you'll need to update it during pairing.

https.title: Enable Secure Connection
https.subtitle: Required for PWA installation
https.intro: HTTPS is required to install the remote control as a Progressive Web App (PWA) on your phone or tablet.
https.step2: QBZ will generate a self-signed certificate
https.whyReason1: Modern browsers require HTTPS for PWA installation
https.whyReason2: Secure connection protects your pairing token
https.whyReason3: Required for service workers and offline features

certificate.title: Install Certificate
certificate.subtitle: Trust the QBZ certificate on your device
certificate.intro: Since QBZ uses a self-signed certificate, you need to install and trust it on your controlling device.
certificate.step1: Copy the certificate URL from QBZ settings
certificate.step2: Open the URL on your controlling device's browser
certificate.step4: Trust the certificate for web browsing
certificate.iosStep1: Open the certificate URL in Safari
certificate.iosStep3: Go to Settings → Profile Downloaded → Install
certificate.iosStep4: Go to Settings → General → About → Certificate Trust Settings
certificate.iosStep5: Enable full trust for the QBZ certificate
certificate.macosStep1: Open the certificate URL in Safari
certificate.macosStep3: Keychain Access will open - add to login keychain
certificate.macosStep5: Set "When using this certificate" to "Always Trust"
certificate.windowsStep1: Open the certificate URL in any browser
certificate.windowsStep5: Select "Place all certificates in: Trusted Root Certification Authorities"
certificate.androidStep1: Open the certificate URL in Chrome
certificate.androidStep4: Select "VPN and apps" or "Wi-Fi" as usage type

pair.title: Pair Your Device
pair.subtitle: Connect to QBZ
pair.intro: Now connect your controlling device to QBZ using the QR code or manual entry.
pair.qrStep2: Open the QBZ Control URL on your device
pair.qrStep3: Scan the QR code to auto-fill connection details
pair.manualStep1: Note the Local URL shown in QBZ
pair.manualStep2: Open this URL on your controlling device
pair.manualStep3: Enter the URL and token manually
pair.trouble1: Make sure both devices are on the same network
pair.trouble2: Check that the firewall allows port 8182
pair.trouble3: Verify HTTPS is enabled and certificate is trusted

done.title: Setup Complete!
done.subtitle: You can now control QBZ remotely
done.pwaHint: For the best experience, install QBZ Control as a PWA:
done.pwaStep1: Open the control URL on your device
done.pwaStep2: Use "Add to Home Screen" or "Install App"
done.pwaStep3: Launch from your home screen for fullscreen experience
